name: Volunteers of America Mid-States Freedom House
description: Comprehensive substance use disorder recovery program specifically designed for pregnant and parenting women, allowing children to stay with their mothers during treatment. Freedom House provides evidence-based clinical services with a focus on family-centered treatment, addressing the cycle of addiction while simultaneously treating mothers and supporting healthy child development. Services include individual and group therapy, medication-assisted treatment, parenting classes, life skills training, vocational support, and case management. The program has achieved significant success rates with 84% of Louisville clients and 96% of Manchester clients seeing increased visitations or reunification with their children.
source: Verified from official VOA Mid-States website and multiple third-party directories
eligibility: Pregnant and parenting women with substance use disorder, children under 18 can stay with mothers during treatment
services: Substance use disorder treatment, medication-assisted treatment, individual and group therapy, parenting classes, life skills training, vocational support, case management, family reunification support, transitional housing for graduates
notes: Multiple locations: 1436 Shelby St, Louisville, KY 40217 and 1025 2nd St, Louisville, KY 40203. Manchester location available at 8467 N Hwy 421, Manchester, KY 40962 (606-658-8050). Program allows unlimited number of children under 18 to stay with mothers. Provides comprehensive family-centered treatment with 84-96% success rates for family reunification.
